newsitem.title: ESTONIA: TALSE AT NEW HIGH, HANSA LEADS THE WAY.
newsitem.headline: TALSE AT NEW HIGH, HANSA LEADS THE WAY.

text.p: The bourse index set yet another
new high on Monday, boosted by market leader Hansapank and other
bank stocks including Forekspank.
On the free list, Norma starred with turnover of 12.8
million kroons.
Total trade on the main list was 27.5 million kroons with
the Talse index 1.50 percent higher at 286.83.
"There were plenty of buyers around in Hansa and Foreks this
morning and no sellers, so this took prices up very quickly,"
one dealer said.
"There was not much liquidity about so price gains were
exceptional. We should be on line for a correction soon,"
another trader said.
Hansapank led the charge to rise by 4.55 kroons to close at
157.25 kroons on trade of 13.4 million kroons.
Hansapank shares in Helsinki followed the Tallinn
gains on low trade. It ended 3 up at 60 markka.
Forekspank was actively bought before it announced
first-half profits of 50.4 million kroons near the close.
Dealers said the actual results had little impact on trade
as it ended 1.35 kroons higher at 198.50 on turnover of 4.9
million kroons.
"The price of Forekspank had already reached its level
before the results came out," another trader said.
On the free market investors and spectulators alike have now
turned their attention to the results of car seat belt
manufacturer Norma.
Norma saw trade of 12.8 million kroons to close 1.15 kroons
higher on 74.40 kroons.
"There is a strong expectation of good results from Norma,
but nothing official as yet," one trader said.
-- David Mardiste, Tallinn newsroom, +372 620 9202
reuters@reuters.ee
